review_blob:
Clear, light amber color. Nice lacing. Medium-light body. Big orange flavors and citrusy. Very nice!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a creamy, khaki colored head. Color is flat black. Lots of orange peeled textured lace coverage. Smells of light roast, cocoa, toast, tootsie roll, starfruit, pine needles, green leafiness, teaberry and caramel. On the palate it is medium bodied, creamy and a little chalky. Taste is same as the nose, add floral notes, orange and wood. Finishes with that teaberry/mint/pine thing that I like in a bipa. Love it!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: South County Black Cowgirl Black Double IPA

review_blob:
Corked and caged 375ml bottle from brewery. Pours syrupy and black with a half finger tan head. When held up to the light you can tell it's really a very dark brown. Very little lace, only a couple spots and only a small ring of foam at half way point. Big aromas of fig, raisins, wood and brown sugar. Full body, creamy carbonation with some prickliness from the alcohol. Taste is mainly fig then bourbon, black licorice, cocoa nibs, chocolate cake, caramel, anise, brown sugar, oak and some hops in the finish prolonging the figginess. Totally different than the standard Flying Mouflan. I'd like a little more bourbon.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Arooga's. Pours a very clear, light amber with a nice white creamy head. Excellent peeled lace. Aromas of toasted grains, pilsner malts and light floral hops. Medium-light body, creamy and a nice crisp. Refreshing. Tastes the same as it smells with dried grassy notes and light caramel notes. I shouldn't be surprised that this is as good as it is. This is Troegs we're talking about.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From tap, it's straw colored and has nice thick lace. Nose surprised me with fruity notes, but also a little sour. Taste is fruity, tart, floral with light grains and some mild sour esters. Light and crisp. A nice representation of the style with a traditional base, but a unique flare. I'd take this over most of the Kolsch I had in Cologne.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Picked up a half-growler from Al's of Hampden. Gold color with a two finger, white, dimpled, foam head. Pineapple nose dominates, but more of a pine taste. Sharp grapefruit hoppiness, fusel notes, citrus, big pine, some biscuity malts with sweetness of apricot and pineapple. Medium+ body and smooth with some bite in the finish. A nice DIPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours an off-white, thick, quilted head. Quite murky as I got the bottom of the bottle poured in my glass. Color is an amber-orange and lace is creamy. Medium-full body that's like a fuzzy cacti. Tastes of pine needles, pine resin, tea, orange zest, tropical juice, crackery malts and some perfume. It's pine tea.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a big, bubbly, tan head. Color is black with cola highlights around the edges. Awesome, thick, frothy lace. Aromas of pine, black malts, char, dry earth, citrus notes and faint cocoa. Medium body, soft feel then finishing with some pine bitterness. Tastes much like it smells with the pine being the biggest factor. Not overly bitter. Some spicy rye as it warms. Overall, a nice balance between a smooth and bitter black ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a one finger, off-white, creamy head. Color is a clear amber with lots of lace blanketing coverage. Aroma of pine, grapefruit flesh and citrus peel. Medium body, bitter upfront and in the middle, but dries out some in the finish, but still some remaining bitterness. Tastes of pine, grapefruit flesh and peel, grass with bitterness and resinous. Quite good and I enjoyed, but needs to be more dynamic to get to next level.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a finger high, white dimpled head. Color is honey gold and there's nice patches of lace. Aroma is peppery with pine hops, but as it warms there's peaches n' cream and grapefruit peel. Almost medium bodied on the palate with prickly tight carbonation. Malts are like a blend of pale, Munich and biscuit. Peppery, pine hops, grain, peach skin, subtle hints of alcohol and perfume. 
Overall a nice brew. Sort of crazy how it seemed to change from piney to fruity to perfumey as it warmed just slightly. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Pizza Boy The Hardest Part IPA

review_blob:
On tap, it had a mahogany black color and no lace. Aroma of cocoa and vanilla. Medium body and smooth on the palate. Tastes of light roast, vanilla notes, faint tobacco, oats, cocoa and light coffee. More on the oatmeal/sweet stout side.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bronze amber and clear with an off white/beige head and nice lacing. Smells citrusy with biscuit malts and pine needles. Taste has more of the same, caramel malts, light resin and pine needles. Very good. Enjoyed very much after a contrasting Imperial stout. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Noticed on Instagram that Al's of Hampden tapped a keg at one o'clock on Tuesday. Left work early to drive 45 minutes to arrive at 4:50. Keg was kicked at 5:10. I was fortunate to get a 4oz pour of this black gold. Very little head and no lace. Smelled of bourbon and whiskey, coffee, roasted malts and vanilla. Sweet tasting like Canadian whiskey, coffee, vanilla, faint maple syrup and nice hops lingering in the finish. Worth the trip. It was the awesome.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Founders Backstage Series # 2: CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)

review_blob:
Pours a nice sized, bone-white, creamy-bubbly head. Orange colored with fine suspended debris and a few wispy strings of lace. Smells of coffee, some oats, some cocoa and sweet malts. It has a medium body and is creamy with alcohol highlights in the finish. Tastes of coffee and cocoa right up front and then the alcohol sweetness kicks in very quickly. It also has some sweet malts, vanilla and leafy-grass hops. A little strange at first as I've never had anything like this, but after half a glass in, I really started digging it.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Stone Stochasticity Project Master of Disguise

review_blob:
Bright, straw color with a half finger, very bright, white head and no lacing. 
Aroma is a pale maltiness, a little funky, light leather, lemongrass, grapefruit, orange, citrus hop and light dried pine needles. It has a light body, tartness and it's dry. Taste is similar to nose with some sourness, floral and grass like a meadow, apricot and mustiness. Overall it seems thin at first, but gets better and better. Reminds me of a tart, less hoppy Stone Go To IPA by the end. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a white, wispy, foam head. Color is gold and very clear with big popping carbonation bubbles. Floral yeast esters, citrus, light crackers, mild fruits and very faint pilsner malt in the nose. It's light bodied with medium carbonation. Tastes of pale malts, dried corn, floral yeast, light spices, light phenolics and the floral hops lingers. Not what I expected and I think it should've been hoppier. The yeast really takes over and makes it seem like a hoppy Belgian Pale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Copper-orange color and slightly cloudy. Poured a nice two finger, bone white, dimpled head. Big frothy walls of lace. English IPA smelling for sure. Carapils malts, earthy hops, hay, herbal hops and fruit esters. Taste the same as the nose with nice fruity esters, green tea and faint pine. A solid English IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2013 Keg. Pours black with a light brown, big, frothy head. Awesome froth totally drapes the glass. Thick, creamy and a sharp hop finish. Heavily roasted black malts, black licorice pipes, sharp earthy hops, caramel, coffee and some cocoa. Yummy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Honey gold color with a white, frothy head and lots of frothy lace. Grapefruit and perfume in the nose is easily detected, but not all in your face. Light on the palate. Tastes of grapefruit, pale grains and some citrus, but overall it seems thin. Enjoyable, but not hoppy enough to reach harvest or ipa status imo.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pale yellow color with some soapy lace. Citrus and floral notes are light on the nose. Body is light and it finishes dry. 
Taste is perfumey up front, followed by floral hops and some citrus. Overall it has much lighter qualities than I expected.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob:
Poured a nice, creamy, tan head. Black in color with brown highlights. Fat, creamy lace arms. Big raisin aroma with wine, phenolic yeast, clove, brown sugar, figs, spices and sugary dates. Medium body with ample carbonation and very smooth. Tastes much like it smells with just a hint of alcohol and a faint grassy hop in the finish. Very good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very clear, light amber color with nice carbonation. Aromas of cereal grains, caramel malts, faint strawberry, grapes, husky malts and pilsner like bitterness. Taste is similar to nose, but more sweet and boozy. It also has grainy malts, tropical notes and banana. Medium body and creamy smooth. A very drinkable 10% beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Lots of sediment in the bottom of the bottle, but it ended up pouring quite clear. The head receded quickly and there was no lace for the duration, but still it has a nice amber color. Smells sweet with a caramel and corn maltiness. Taste is very fusel. There is no hiding that 15% of alcohol. Syrupy sweetness upfront, corn maltiness midway and a grassy pilsner quality in the finish. Alcohol through and through. It's oily with a medium body, some bite and hot alcohol. This one had me scared going into it with the low ratings. I actually thought it was going to be quite bad. Not hateful though and it had me quite buzzed with high abv and .5L size.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a two finger sized, creamy, bone-white colored head. Color is golden-orange. Medium body and creamy. Green tea is very apparent and integrated well into the double ipa flavors that are of citrus, white grapefruit, caramel malts, spicy hops and herbal hops. It's very cool how the flavors of the beer blend perfectly with the green tea.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Baird / Ishii / Stone Japanese Green Tea IPA 10.1% (2015)

review_blob:
From a growler it pours a nicely sized, dimpled, light khaki colored head. Color is dark mahogany. Tastes like chocolate malt, black barley, hops, almonds, spruce and perfume. It has some fruitiness in the nose like papaya. A nice cascadian ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Looks refreshing with a bright golden color. Smells of fruity yeast esters, citrus, vanilla and light spices. More of the same in the taste. Also, wheat, honey, oat sweetness, faint banana, apple and lemon. Light to medium body and finishes dry. A very nice Tripel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Big chocolate aromas, caramel, vanilla and some oat sweetness. Taste lots of chocolate which I expected from the nose, but also house coffee, caramel, dried grass, light char, marshmallow and some oat sweetness. Surprisingly lasting hop note in the finish. A nicely defined foreign stout. Right between a stout and imperial stout. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Left Hand Fade To Black Vol. 1: Foreign Stout

review_blob:
Suds ooze out as soon as the cap is popped. Unfiltered and cloudy with some big chunks that fell to the bottom. The color is honey-orange. Belgian yeast esters that are floral and fruity like a smoothy with bananas. There's some mild phenolic spice, along with cloves. Medicine notes and faint caramel come out as it warms. Light bodied with ample carbonation. The phenolics show up more in the taste and yield some band-aid and plastic qualities. Spices are mild, but definitely clove. Also, there's fruits, banana, crackers, light wood and finishes with yeast esters and hops. Leaves a nice aftertaste and there seems to be plenty going on for the style, if picked apart, but somehow gets all washed out right in the middle.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Color is black and when held to the light the mahogany tones at the bottom show. Lots of creamy lace. In the nose, there are black malts and an ash base with a little spice from the rye. Plenty of hop aromas of citrus, spruce, and even floral notes. The chocolate toffee comes out as it warms. Medium body, creamy and finishing with a subtle heat. Tasting black malts, ash, citrus, spruce, chocolate, toffee and finishing with pine and spruce. This is Dark Penance's little brother. He smokes and has a lot of attitude.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a one finger, light brown, creamy head. Color is black with mahogany edges when held up to the light. Stringy, soapy lace. Freshly ground coffee aromas. Medium body and creamy smooth. Tastes of coffee beans, faint vanilla, sour acidic notes in the middle and some fruity hops at the end, but the hops don't last long before the coffee takes back over. Overall, I like how the coffee is most dominant, but the porter quality is still there.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a nice size tan, rocky head. Color is reddish brown and a little cloudy. Good head retention and big patches of frothy lace. Tart smell of cherries, sour like apple cider vinegar, highlights of brown sugar and a faint wet dog quality. It has a light body and somewhat tart, but finishes dry. Tastes sweet, sour and quite tart with qualities of cherries, brown malts, cherry cider, faint vinegar, apple cider, fruity esters, and a faint nuttiness in the finish. I used to think this beer was so vinegar-like, but now I really dig it. Crazy how tastes change. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a one finger, bone white to khaki colored, creamy head. It's a very murky, brown color. At first it smells sour. As it warms, I get caramel and bourbon. It's got a medium plus body with some carbonation, but a little on the flat side. Vanilla taste right upfront, followed quickly by bourbon in the middle, then finishing with caramelized sugar and cocoa nibs. This is quite good, but might be better after aging a little.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a half finger, tan, creamy head. Dark brown color with a reddish tone. Smells of molasses, dried cherries, caramel, sugar and some faint nuttiness. On the palate it is medium-full bodied and creamy tight. It has a solid malt base that's on the sweeter side that's making me think of cherry Ludens. Backed up with peat, earthy hops and nutty in the back. This beer is solid. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thought it would be cloudy from notes on the bottle, but it's quite clear with lots of streaming carbonation. Color is pale yellow. Yeast esters of apple and pear combines with unsweet canned corn in the nose along with pale malts, a light toastiness, mild wheat, oats and hints of Brazilian nuts. Mostly the same in the taste, but rather watery. Light body and crisp and nice peeled lacing. Just ok.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured a half finger, beige, foamy head that receded rather quickly. It doesn't look as thick as I expected. Color is brown with mahogany tones. No lacing. A nose full of roasted malts, highlights of cherry juice sweetness, hints of cocoa nibs and strawberry Twizzlers. Medium bodied with tight medium carbonation. A hearty base of roasted malts and coffee flavors in the taste followed by sweet notes of cherry juice, hints of alcohol and chocolate, finishing with Twizzlers type sweetness and some leafy hops in the finish. Overall it's less sweet than I expected. Pretty solid. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a 1/2 finger, beige, creamy head. Color is dark brown. Black malts, earthy hops, faint root beer barrel candy, moist earth, light char, faint fudge and herbal notes in the nose. Medium body, creamy and a light fusel note in the finish. Tastes of black malts, herbal hops, some char, licorice and it's quite sprucy with leafy hops. Towers of lace the whole way around the glass. I'm mixed with this beer. Sometimes it tastes really good and other times it seams a little too earthy or something. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

It's got a cloudy apricot color. Smells of citrus juice, pineapple, cat pee, pine resin and hop oil. It has a medium+ body with a medium amount of carbonation, but it's tight and almost creamy. Tastes of citrus and tropical juice, pale sweet malts and biscuity malts, hop resin and pine oil. It goes down quite easy for 8.5%.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Color is light, pale yellow with fine, suspended debris. Some nice patches of delicate lace. Smells of grainy malts, lager yeast, light citrus, lemon and sweet corn. Tastes similar. Gristy malts, bitter hops, orange pith and light tangerine. Light bodied, crisp and dry. This would be a good summer session beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

You've gotta like raspberry to like this beer. Quite sweet, a little sour and lightly roasted in that order. Raspberry cocoa, chocolate and hints of coffee. Same in the nose. Velvety, smooth mouthfeel with a medium body. Thins a little as it warms. Definitely a dessert beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

BOD:2014.10.17
The rye with the hops give it some spiciness in the nose. Hops are sprucy, earthy and leafy on top a rye, grainy malt base. Color is on the light side of amber and it's unfitered, so fine debris throughout. Good peeled lace coverage. Medium body and creamy smooth feeling soft on the palate. Tastes of spicy hops, rye, grains, green pepper and bitter leafy hops with a fusel quality throughout. Not sure where they get the red.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Ithaca Rustic Harvest Red Rye India Pale Ale

review_blob:
Poured a huge, light brown, whipped, root beer float head. Split a bomber with buddy and it took some care to get these poured. Black in color and brown when held to the light. Aromas are chocolatey and nutty. Felt thin for an Imperial Porter. Chocolate and nutty just like the nose with tin notes halfway through. Also some light pecan and coffee notes as well. No bourbon or wood flavors and it doesn't remind me at all of pecan pie. This one is only three months old and it has the tinny metallic notes that I do not care for. Regardless, I think they missed the target on this one. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Chocolate seems to be the aroma that stands out the most backed up by semi-roasted and coffee malts. The taste is about the same with some light fruits and sweet malts, but it doesn't push the envelope. Sort of a run of the mill imperial stout and almost drinks like a standard stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Black color with crimson tones. Whiskey, anise, currants and light toffee in the nose. Also tastes of whiskey and anise. Add notes of chocolate, toffee, roasted barley, dark cherries, coffee, light molasses and caramel malts. Medium-full body. Darn good, but thought it would be even better.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a big, off-white, creamy head. Color is red amber. Frothy lava lace. Spicy hops, citrus pith, sweet grains, floral notes and German malts in the nose. Medium body with a cooling mouthfeel somewhat similar to spearmint. Tastes of wet bitter grains, spicy hops, spearmint, leafy hops, raw sugar, spruce, pine, orange peel, German malts, floral and sugar cookie in the finish. Very unique and I dig it.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a big, khaki, root beer float head. Color is light black and brown looking when held up to the light. Excellent thick patterned froth. Smells of pine, fruitiness like raspberry, black malt and spearmint. Palate is light bodied, crisp and finishes on the dry side. Tastes of spearmint is dominating flavor over black malts, but it's mild and a little watery. Stone fruit, pine needles and very faint chocolate cake also. Overall, it comes in a little thin, but for 4.2% it's pretty good. I love Cascadian ales and my first time having a session level one. I'd buy it if available year round. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Widmer Brothers 30th Anniversary Collaboration #1: Blacklight IPA

review_blob:
On tap, it was served with a big, white dimpled head. Lots of draping lace and also thick creamy rings. Smells very dank over pale malts and floral notes. Tastes just like it smells. This is a home run by Sierra Nevada and my favorite of their Harvest Ales that I've had. Don't understand why there aren't more of the higher ratings. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Sierra Nevada Harvest Wild Hop IPA - Neomexicanus

review_blob:
Cola look to the color with a big, bone white, creamy head with nice creamy lacing. Nice looking. Surprised me with Belgian yeast notes in the nose. Also smells of phenolics, some spices and sour notes. Tastes like original old school Nyquil. In general, sort of medicinal, unsweet stone fruits, sour notes and spicy farmhouse yeast. Not a fan.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Looks like juice with no head or lacing. Smells like cider with faint sour notes and lemon. Tastes like apple juice, cherry juice, very faint funk, mildy tart but more like apple juice sweetness with a little lemon. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A nice looking strong ale with it's khaki, bubbly head, mahogany-red color and ample lacing. Smells of cherry sauce, ripe grapefruit and pine. The pine follows up big in the taste along with caramel malts, molasses, ripe grapefruit, grassy-leafy hops and some oak. Solid!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Similar to their pale ale, but hoppier and some pilsner qualities. Orange, lime, and faintly floral in the nose. Mostly light bodied and somewhat foamy with a lingering bitterness. Tastes of grainy, pale malts, orange pith, lime, floral notes, grass and pilsner malt. A nice looking beer with lots of foamy lace. Color is bright yellow and there's lot of suspended sediment.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
